alert.note: Alert for Braxton; Calhoun; Clay; Gilmer; Jackson; Kanawha; Roane (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 8:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Calhoun, northeastern Kanawha, southwestern Gilmer, west central Braxton, southern Roane, northwestern Clay and southeastern Jackson Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sissonville, or 14 miles north of Charleston, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Sissonville, Clendenin, Pinch, Coal Fork, Elkview, Arnoldsburg, Big Otter, Wallback, Amma, Nebo, Shock, Millstone, Procious, Rosedale, Mount Zion, Left Hand, Stumptown, Wilsie and Tariff. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 44. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 103 and 119. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central, western, north central and northwestern West Virginia.
